theme: एष हि द्रष्टा ... कर्ता विज्ञानात्मा पुरुषः  (प्रश्नो. ४-९)

terms.शास्त्रार्थवत्त्वात्: because of the purport of the scriptures
terms: वत् (vattvat) - This is a suffix that means "because of" or "due to".

meaning: Explanation:The verse "कर्ता शास्त्रार्थवत्त्वात्" is from the Brahma Sutras, which is a text of Indian philosophy. Let's break down the verse to understand its meaning.Putting it together, the verse can be translated as:"Because of the purport of the scriptures, the doer."This verse highlights the importance of the scriptures in understanding the nature of the doer or agent. It suggests that the concept of a doer is derived from the purport or intended meaning of the scriptures. In other words, our understanding of the doer is influenced by the teachings and explanations found in the sacred texts.
